title: 110_hr1407
content:
The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221 based on modified adjusted gross income. The deduction amount is reduced based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with specific thresholds for single and joint filers. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the phaseout beginning point for the deduction under section 221 based on modified adjusted gross income. The amendments also include a conforming adjustment for taxable years beginning after 2008, with an effective date after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Amendment to Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by striking subsection (e). Effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007.

SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. Increase in allowable contributions from $2,000 to $5,000. Amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. Reporting deadline extended to June 30 of the following year. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. SEC. 5 amends the Internal Revenue Code to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. It also defines these terms according to section 529(e) and removes restrictions on tuition reduction programs below the graduate level. The amendments made by this section allow for qualified higher education expenses to be included for enrollment at eligible educational institutions, removing restrictions on tuition reduction programs below the graduate level. These amendments apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods starting after that date. Expansion of educational expenses allowed as part of Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Additionally, the Hope Scholarship Credit will not be reduced by Federal Pell Grants or Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants. The amendments made by this section expand qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. The amendments also specify that the Expanded Hope Expenses are not subject to information reporting requirements. These changes apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods beginning after that date. SEC. 7. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for certain education provisions: Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to subtitles A, B, and D of title IV of the Act.
